III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor spit on Youth D.
Investigation Interviews:
I was assigned this investigation on 5/1/24 and informed Youth D
was hospitalized.
I interviewed Former Staff on the phone on 5/1/24. She said she
was terminated by the facility on 4/30/24 for reasons unknown to
her. Former Staff said Youth D told her that Supervisor spit on
her, but she did not witness it.
On 5/2/24 Government Worker 1 and I went to Garden City
Hospital to interview Youth D, but she had already been
discharged.
I interviewed Youth D jointly with Government Worker 1 at the
facility on 5/2/24. She had been there for six weeks. Asked if
Supervisor spit on her, she said “No. I don’t know who said that.
It never happened.”
Youth K, Youth C and Youth A were interviewed separately. All
youths denied Supervisor spit on Youth D. Youth K said Youth D
“says crazy stuff.” Youth C said, “Youth D is the one who spits on
people.”
I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government Worker 1. He
has worked at the facility for two years and has three years of
experience working in another child caring institution. Supervisor
denied he ever spit on Youth D.
2

I interviewed Team Leader jointly with Government Worker 1. He
has worked at the facility for one year and has 27 years of
experience working in child caring institutions. Team Leader
denied that Supervisor ever spit on Youth D.
Documents reviewed:
There were no incident reports indicating Supervisor spit on Youth
D.
Employee records indicate Supervisor has a memo of
understanding resulting from another recent investigation in which
he agreed to make conscious effort to be in view of cameras at all
times, including when passing medication. He was given a verbal
warning on 1/29/24 for violating protocol for not reporting a client
injury or seeking medical treatment. Supervisor also had verbal
warnings on 7/6/22 and 9/7/22 for tardiness.
Analysis Youth D, Supervisor and all parties interviewed denied Supervisor
spit on Youth D.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Former Staff saw Supervisor horseplay with Youth D and poke her
in the stomach, which made Youth D feel comfortable. Youths
told Former Staff that Supervisor had an inappropriate
conversation with them about twerking.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth D denied Supervisor poked her in the stomach or horse
played with her or any other youths. She was unaware of any
inappropriate conversations.
Youth K said youths and Supervisor joke around “appropriately.”
“There’s no pushing or touching. It’s not overdone. There’s no
3

poking in the stomach. There are no uncomfortable
conversations…One time Supervisor redirected me for twerking.”
Youth C, Youth A, Supervisor and Team Leader denied
Supervisor horse plays, poked a youth in the stomach or
conversed with youths inappropriately about twerking or anything
else.
Documents reviewed:
There were no incident reports pertaining to Supervisor
horseplaying, poking youths or having inappropriate conversations
with them.
Analysis All youths and staff interviewed denied Supervisor behaves
inappropriately with youth. There is no evidence to support that
Supervisor lacks the ability to perform the duties of his assigned
position.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention.
(b) Denial of any essential program service as punishment.
These include, but are not limited to, the following:
(i) Food or creating alternative menus
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Former Staff saw Team Leader refuse to take youths to the
kitchen for water after bedtime and refuse them snacks outside of
mealtimes.
Investigation Interviews:
Former Staff said she saw Team Leader refuse to take youths to
the kitchen for water after bedtime and refuse them snacks
outside of mealtimes.
Youth D said Team Leader denies youth extra snacks after
bedtime, but this is not a punishment. She said an unidentified
4

staff told her she could refill her water bottle with tap water from
the sink, which in her opinion was wrong.
Youth K said youths are offered three meals a day and two
snacks between meals. She denied Team Leader denies them
food or water as a punishment. She referred to Team Leader as
“an old man” who sometimes jokes with youths. One time, she
said Team Leader made her feel uncomfortable when he told
Youth C that she is the most beautiful girl on the wing.
Youth C said Team Leader allows her to fill her water bottle and
hands out snacks. She recalled a lighthearted conversation with
Team Leader when he would not take her to the kitchen for water
because it was closed. Youth C joked with Team Leader and
said, “I may as well drink from the toilet” and Team Leader
responded, “You may as well.” Youth C was not serious about
drinking from the toilet and knew Team Leader was not
suggesting she actually do it. Youth C described Team Leader as
“weird” because he told her she is the most beautiful girl.
Youth A said Team Leader doles out snacks at designated times.
“He never refused us water. He’s real cool.”
Supervisor denied any awareness of Team Leader denying
youths food and water as a form of punishment. He added, “Kids
are not refused meals. The kitchen closes at 8pm. After bedtime,
we try to keep youths out of the kitchen.”
Team Leader said he has never denied a youth snacks or water
as a form of punishment. Sometimes, he said he gets water for
the youths even after the kitchen is closed for the night. Team
Leader did not recall any conversation with a youth pertaining to
drinking from the toilet.
Document reviewed:
Employee records indicate on 4/16/24 Team Leader was placed
on a performance plan for the following areas: judgement, job
knowledge, delegation and medication passing.
Analysis There was no evidence Team Leader denied youths food or other
essential program services as punishment.
CONSULTATION
Team Leader should be reminded that complimenting youths
should be avoided as it may cause feelings of discomfort and/or
be interpreted as grooming.
5

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
